title: Scroll of identify
data:
| ? [![Scroll.png](/images/8/8d/Scroll.png)](/wiki/File:Scroll.png) |                                                               |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                              | identify                                                      |
| Appearance                                                        | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Base price                                                        | 20 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                              |
| Weight                                                            | 5                                                             |
| Ink to write                                                      | [7–13](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker")                     |
| Monster use                                                       | *Will not be used by monsters.*                               |

A **scroll of identify** is a type of [scroll](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. When read, it [identifies](/wiki/Identify "Identify") items in the player's [inventory](/wiki/Inventory "Inventory"), with the amount of items identified based on its [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Identification](#Identification)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [6.2 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [6.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [6.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [6.5 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

18% of all randomly generated scrolls will be a scroll of identify, making it somewhat common.

Writing a scroll of identify with a [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker") takes up 7 to 13 charges.

## Description

Scrolls of identify are always safe to read, but noncursed scrolls usually identify more items. When read, the scroll will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") itself and reveal the full identity of at least one chosen item in the player's open inventory;[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) if a scroll would identify a number of items less than the amount of unidentified items in the inventory, the player chooses which items to identify.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) If the scroll is read while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused"), it will auto-identify itself with no further effect.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

If the scroll is blessed or uncursed, it will identify 1, 2, 3, 4, or all items in the inventory, with the probability of each number given in the table below, while a cursed scroll will only identify one item.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) If the player's [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") is positive, a blessed scroll will always identify at least two items, with a 3⁄5 chance of identifying more.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

| Scroll BUC | Number of items |      |      |      |      |
| ---------- | --------------- | ---- | ---- | ---- | ---- |
|            | 1               | 2    | 3    | 4    | all  |
| Blessed    | 1⁄5             | 1⁄5  | 1⁄5  | 1⁄5  | 1⁄5  |
| Uncursed   | 21⁄25           | 1⁄25 | 1⁄25 | 1⁄25 | 1⁄25 |
| Cursed     | 1               | 0    | 0    | 0    | 0    |

## Strategy

Before reading any scroll(s) of identify, be sure to have as many unidentified items in your open inventory as is reasonably possible; if you have [holy water](/wiki/Potion_of_holy_water "Potion of holy water") to spare, you can bless your scroll(s) beforehand to increase the chance of identifying more items. If reading the scroll(s) of identify in a [shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop"), you can also use price identification to prioritize which of the shop's wares to formally identify and get the most out of your scrolls.

A role such as [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest") or [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") that can learn the [identify](/wiki/Spellbook_of_identify "Spellbook of identify") spell and train [divination spells](/wiki/Divination_spells "Divination spells") to [Skilled](/wiki/Skilled "Skilled") or better can potentially render scrolls of identify redundant, though they may still be useful if the spell is forgotten at any point (e.g., you have also forgotten several other item identities due to a [mind flayer](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer") or an ill-advised [scroll of amnesia](/wiki/Scroll_of_amnesia "Scroll of amnesia")). A reliably-cast identify spell in combination with a source of energy such as [The Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica") lets you identify any object soon after you discover it, even if you only want to know its beatitude.

### Identification

The scroll of identify is the only scroll with a base price of 20zm, making [price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification") trivial; it is also one of the most common scrolls randomly generated in the dungeon, to the point that the largest stack of unidentified scrolls in your inventory has a decent-but-unreliable chance of being a stack of identify scrolls.

## History

The scroll of identify first appears in Hack 1.21, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and also appears in Hack for PDP-11. It is included in the initial item list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Messages

- What do you want to identify first?

  You read a scroll of identify, auto-identifying it and prompting you to select an item in your inventory that is not fully identified.

- You identify this as an identify scroll.

  You read a scroll of identify while confused.

## Variants

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), every role begins the game with knowledge of the label for the scroll of identify.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), to counterbalance the removal of the identify spell, scrolls of identify are made more reliable: Blessed scrolls always identify 7 items, and uncursed scrolls always identify 4, while cursed scrolls only identify 1 item. Reading a scroll of identify while confused will "identify yourself" and give [enlightenment](/wiki/Enlightenment "Enlightenment").

When reading a cursed scroll of identify, the game may randomly print the phrase "[Do you want your possessions identified?](/wiki/Do_you_want_your_possessions_identified%3F "Do you want your possessions identified?")" in place of the usual prompt.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") and [SpliceHack-Rewrite](/wiki/SpliceHack-Rewrite "SpliceHack-Rewrite"), the [scroll of knowledge](/wiki/Scroll_of_knowledge "Scroll of knowledge") is a scroll with the same base price as the scroll of identify; 1 out of roughly every 10 scrolls that cost 20 zorkmids will be a scroll of knowledge, making price identifying scrolls of identify slightly less trivial.

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") incorporates the SporkHack change that gives every role starting knowledge of the scroll of identify.

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") incorporates both the SporkHack change granting every role knowledge of the scroll of identify (via EvilHack) and the scroll of knowledge from SpliceHack; due to the former change, the scroll of knowledge's base price is raised to 50zm in order to make it less trivial to identify via price.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1482](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L1482)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1506](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L1506)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1488](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L1488)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1499](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L1499)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1502](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L1502)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Scroll of identify

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
?
Name identify
Appearance random
Base price 20 zm
Weight 5
Ink to write 7–13
Monster use Will not be used by monsters.

A scroll of identify is a type of scroll that appears in NetHack. When read, it identifies items in the player's inventory, with the amount of items identified based on its beatitude.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
    • 3.1 Identification
  • 4 History
  • 5 Messages
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SporkHack
    • 6.2 xNetHack
    • 6.3 SpliceHack
    • 6.4 EvilHack
    • 6.5 Hack'EM
  • 7 References

Generation

18% of all randomly generated scrolls will be a scroll of identify, making it somewhat common.

Writing a scroll of identify with a magic marker takes up 7 to 13 charges.

Description

Scrolls of identify are always safe to read, but noncursed scrolls usually identify more items. When read, the scroll will auto-identify itself and reveal the full identity of at least one chosen item in the player's open inventory;[1] if a scroll would identify a number of items less than the amount of unidentified items in the inventory, the player chooses which items to identify.[2] If the scroll is read while confused, it will auto-identify itself with no further effect.[3]

If the scroll is blessed or uncursed, it will identify 1, 2, 3, 4, or all items in the inventory, with the probability of each number given in the table below, while a cursed scroll will only identify one item.[4] If the player's Luck is positive, a blessed scroll will always identify at least two items, with a 3⁄5 chance of identifying more.[5]

Scroll
BUC		 Number of items
1 2 3 4 all
Blessed 1⁄5 1⁄5 1⁄5 1⁄5 1⁄5
Uncursed 21⁄25 1⁄25 1⁄25 1⁄25 1⁄25
Cursed 1 0 0 0 0

Strategy

Before reading any scroll(s) of identify, be sure to have as many unidentified items in your open inventory as is reasonably possible; if you have holy water to spare, you can bless your scroll(s) beforehand to increase the chance of identifying more items. If reading the scroll(s) of identify in a shop, you can also use price identification to prioritize which of the shop's wares to formally identify and get the most out of your scrolls.

A role such as Priest or Wizard that can learn the identify spell and train divination spells to Skilled or better can potentially render scrolls of identify redundant, though they may still be useful if the spell is forgotten at any point (e.g., you have also forgotten several other item identities due to a mind flayer or an ill-advised scroll of amnesia). A reliably-cast identify spell in combination with a source of energy such as The Eye of the Aethiopica lets you identify any object soon after you discover it, even if you only want to know its beatitude.

Identification

The scroll of identify is the only scroll with a base price of 20zm, making price identification trivial; it is also one of the most common scrolls randomly generated in the dungeon, to the point that the largest stack of unidentified scrolls in your inventory has a decent-but-unreliable chance of being a stack of identify scrolls.

History

The scroll of identify first appears in Hack 1.21, a variant of Jay Fenlason's Hack, and also appears in Hack for PDP-11. It is included in the initial item list for Hack 1.0.

Messages

What do you want to identify first?
You read a scroll of identify, auto-identifying it and prompting you to select an item in your inventory that is not fully identified.
You identify this as an identify scroll.
You read a scroll of identify while confused.

Variants

SporkHack

In SporkHack, every role begins the game with knowledge of the label for the scroll of identify.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, to counterbalance the removal of the identify spell, scrolls of identify are made more reliable: Blessed scrolls always identify 7 items, and uncursed scrolls always identify 4, while cursed scrolls only identify 1 item. Reading a scroll of identify while confused will "identify yourself" and give enlightenment.

When reading a cursed scroll of identify, the game may randomly print the phrase "Do you want your possessions identified?" in place of the usual prompt.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack and SpliceHack-Rewrite, the scroll of knowledge is a scroll with the same base price as the scroll of identify; 1 out of roughly every 10 scrolls that cost 20 zorkmids will be a scroll of knowledge, making price identifying scrolls of identify slightly less trivial.

EvilHack

EvilHack incorporates the SporkHack change that gives every role starting knowledge of the scroll of identify.

Hack'EM

Hack'EM incorporates both the SporkHack change granting every role knowledge of the scroll of identify (via EvilHack) and the scroll of knowledge from SpliceHack; due to the former change, the scroll of knowledge's base price is raised to 50zm in order to make it less trivial to identify via price.

References

  1. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1482
  2. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1506
  3. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1488
  4. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1499
  5. ↑ src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1502

{{scroll |name=identify |cost=20 |ink=7–13}} A '''scroll of identify''' is a type of [[scroll]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. When read, it [[Identify|identifies]] items in the player's [[inventory]], with the amount of items identified based on its [[beatitude]]. ==Generation== 18% of all randomly generated scrolls will be a scroll of identify, making it somewhat common. Writing a scroll of identify with a [[magic marker]] takes up 7 to 13 charges. ==Description== Scrolls of identify are always safe to read, but noncursed scrolls usually identify more items. When read, the scroll will [[auto-identify]] itself and reveal the full identity of at least one chosen item in the player's open inventory;{{refsrc|src/read.c|1482|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} if a scroll would identify a number of items less than the amount of unidentified items in the inventory, the player chooses which items to identify.{{refsrc|src/read.c|1506|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} If the scroll is read while [[confused]], it will auto-identify itself with no further effect.{{refsrc|src/read.c|1488|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} If the scroll is blessed or uncursed, it will identify 1, 2, 3, 4, or all items in the inventory, with the probability of each number given in the table below, while a cursed scroll will only identify one item.{{refsrc|src/read.c|1499|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} If the player's [[Luck]] is positive, a blessed scroll will always identify at least two items, with a {{frac|3|5}} chance of identifying more.{{refsrc|src/read.c|1502|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} {|class="prettytable" style="text-align:center" !rowspan=2| Scroll
BUC !!colspan=5| Number of items |- ! 1 !! 2 !! 3 !! 4 !! all |- !style="background-color:#89ffdd" scope="row"| Blessed |style="background-color:#89ffdd"| {{frac|5}} ||style="background-color:#89ffdd"| {{frac|5}} ||style="background-color:#89ffdd"| {{frac|5}} ||style="background-color:#89ffdd"| {{frac|5}} ||style="background-color:#89ffdd"| {{frac|5}} |- !scope="row"| Uncursed | {{frac|21|25}} || {{frac|25}} || {{frac|25}} || {{frac|25}} || {{frac|25}} |- !style="background-color:#ffdfcf" scope="row"| Cursed |style="background-color:#ffdfcf"| 1 ||style="background-color:#ffdfcf"| 0 ||style="background-color:#ffdfcf"| 0 ||style="background-color:#ffdfcf"| 0 ||style="background-color:#ffdfcf"| 0 |} ==Strategy== Before reading any scroll(s) of identify, be sure to have as many unidentified items in your open inventory as is reasonably possible; if you have {{of|potion|holy water}} to spare, you can bless your scroll(s) beforehand to increase the chance of identifying more items. If reading the scroll(s) of identify in a [[shop]], you can also use price identification to prioritize which of the shop's wares to formally identify and get the most out of your scrolls. A role such as [[Priest]] or [[Wizard]] that can learn the {{spell of|identify}} spell and train [[divination spells]] to [[Skilled]] or better can potentially render scrolls of identify redundant, though they may still be useful if the spell is forgotten at any point (e.g., you have also forgotten several other item identities due to a [[mind flayer]] or an ill-advised [[scroll of amnesia]]). A reliably-cast identify spell in combination with a source of energy such as [[The Eye of the Aethiopica]] lets you identify any object soon after you discover it, even if you only want to know its beatitude. ===Identification=== The scroll of identify is the only scroll with a base price of 20zm, making [[price identification]] trivial; it is also one of the most common scrolls randomly generated in the dungeon, to the point that the largest stack of unidentified scrolls in your inventory has a decent-but-unreliable chance of being a stack of identify scrolls. ==History== The scroll of identify first appears in Hack 1.21, a variant of [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], and also appears in Hack for PDP-11. It is included in the initial item list for [[Hack 1.0]]. ==Messages== {{message|What do you want to identify first?|You read a scroll of identify, auto-identifying it and prompting you to select an item in your inventory that is not fully identified.}} {{message|You identify this as an identify scroll.|You read a scroll of identify while confused.}} ==Variants== ===SporkHack=== In [[SporkHack]], every role begins the game with knowledge of the label for the scroll of identify. ===xNetHack=== In [[xNetHack]], to counterbalance the removal of the identify spell, scrolls of identify are made more reliable: Blessed scrolls always identify 7 items, and uncursed scrolls always identify 4, while cursed scrolls only identify 1 item. Reading a scroll of identify while confused will "identify yourself" and give [[enlightenment]]. When reading a cursed scroll of identify, the game may randomly print the phrase "[[Do you want your possessions identified?]]" in place of the usual prompt. ===SpliceHack=== In [[SpliceHack]] and [[SpliceHack-Rewrite]], the [[scroll of knowledge]] is a scroll with the same base price as the scroll of identify; 1 out of roughly every 10 scrolls that cost 20 zorkmids will be a scroll of knowledge, making price identifying scrolls of identify slightly less trivial. ===EvilHack=== [[EvilHack]] incorporates the SporkHack change that gives every role starting knowledge of the scroll of identify. ===Hack'EM=== [[Hack'EM]] incorporates both the SporkHack change granting every role knowledge of the scroll of identify (via EvilHack) and the scroll of knowledge from SpliceHack; due to the former change, the scroll of knowledge's base price is raised to 50zm in order to make it less trivial to identify via price. ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Scrolls|Identify]] [[Category:Identification]]
